riemann_hypothesis.quick_summary: All non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function have real part equal to 1/2.
riemann_hypothesis.ai_relevance: Medium - Pattern recognition in zeros distribution
riemann_hypothesis.status: Open (most famous unsolved problem in mathematics)
riemann_hypothesis.computational_approach: Numerical analysis, pattern detection with ML, statistical analysis of zeros
riemann_hypothesis.key_insight: Billions of zeros computed, all satisfy hypothesis - neural networks could search for patterns

p_vs_np.quick_summary: Does P = NP? In other words, can every problem whose solution can be quickly verified by a computer also be quickly solved by a computer?
p_vs_np.ai_relevance: **VERY HIGH** - Central to computational complexity and algorithm design
p_vs_np.impact: Central to computational complexity and algorithm design
p_vs_np.ml_connection: Many ML optimization problems are NP-hard

navier_stokes.quick_summary: Prove that solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations (describing fluid flow) always exist and remain smooth, or find a counterexample.
navier_stokes.ai_relevance: **HIGH** - Direct applications in physics-informed neural networks
navier_stokes.practical_use: Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) for fluid simulation
